title: Tablas Creek 2016 Patelin de Tablas Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: The pioneering Haas family pulls from eight vineyards to make this pink blend of 73% Grenache, 17% Mourvèdre, 6% Counoise and 4% Syrah. It shows lemon rind, cantaloupe and steely aromas on the nose. The palate takes hold quickly with its tense grip before unpacking its lush lemon and nectarine flavors.

title: Ravoire et Fils 2016 Château Saint Hippolyte Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: This wine, with its noticeable proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon (20%), has structure and a tangy texture as well as plenty of bright crisp fruit. It has weight, with ripe red fruits dominating the acidity. The estate dates back to the end of the 16th century. Drink this attractive wine now.

title: Rocca del Principe 2015  Fiano di Avellino
description: Pressed yellow flower, almond and honey notes follow through to the rounded, tangy palate, joining salty mineral, mature yellow peach and citrus flavors. Drink soon to capture the fruit and remaining freshness.

title: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2016 Plane Vineyard Pinot Noir Rosé (Finger Lakes)
description: Bright cherry, bramble and spice abound in this dry deftly balanced wine. It's not deeply concentrated on the palate but refreshingly mineral and brisk. Treat this as a thirst-quenching accompaniment to light summer fare.

title: Torricino 2015  Fiano di Avellino
description: Toasted hazelnut, orchard fruit and citrus scents take center stage. On the elegant palate, a flinty mineral note underscores lemon zest and pear flavors while a nutty hint closes the finish.

title: Prime Solum 2013 Brokenrock Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Rich and round, this 100% varietal wine shows generous chocolate brownie aromas, its supple tannins brooding and dense. Clove and cinnamon stick flavors accent its dark black cherry and berry fruit.

title: Pemartín NV Amontillado Palomino (Jerez)
description: Textbook amontillado aromas of butter, peanut, caramel and brine precede a fresh high-energy palate that's fueled by acidity. Nutty flavors of toffee include plenty of salt and some smoke, while this finishes long and slightly fiery.

title: Pianetta 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: There is a lot of Central Coast scrub on the nose of this bottling, with anise and sagebrush spicing up the ripe red cherry and rounded strawberry notes. It's light in body, with loads of dried herb, red plum and tart strawberry flavors, proving easy to drink, with compelling acidity.

title: Gianni Tessari 2016 Monte Tenda  (Soave Classico)
description: Fresh and linear, this offers spring wild flower and white stone fruit aromas while the luminous palate offers Bosc pear, citrus and a hint of white almond. It has a bright, slightly tangy finish.

title: Eight Bells 2013 Red Willow Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)
description: High-toned aromas of herb, flower, spice and cherry are followed by tart elegantly styled fruit flavors. The new oak influence seems minimal. Pair it with food to see it at its best.

title: Epiphany 2014 Hampton Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: A dark core of black plum, blueberry and violet marks the nose of this single-vineyard bottling. The palate showcases purple fruit and floral notes, with concentrated black plum skin and more violet leading the way.

title: Estancia 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This wine has a personality that's both crisp and satisfying. White pepper and light earth aromas lead to tempting peachy flavors and an appealing texture that balances tanginess and richness. The blend includes small portions of Chardonnay, Albariño, Gewürztraminer and Orange Muscat.

title: Hermann Moser 2016 Green Eyes Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Appetizing peardrop notes on the nose lead to a light, refreshing and dry body that's enlivened by fresh spritz. The flavors get a boost of citrus on the clean, refreshing finish.

title: Hilanda 2012 Término de Arriba Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Powerful berry and spice aromas open this jammy slightly heavy Monastell. Desert-herb notes of sage and thyme accent a core blueberry flavor, while this tastes of carob, roasted beet and toast on the finish.

title: I Capitani 2016 Gaudium  (Fiano di Avellino)
description: Spanish broom, honeysuckle and exotic fruit aromas carry over to the rounded palate, along with yellow peach and candied lemon drop notes. A bitter almond flavor closes the finish.

title: Kohl 2016 Gelber Muskateller (Niederösterreich)
description: This wine's honeysuckle-tinged nose comes with zesty grapefruit freshness. The palate is aroamtic, light and dry, with a slightly short but very clean finish. A lovely, light-bodied wine for spring and summer.

title: Fossil Point 2015 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Fleshy red plum and alpine strawberry fruit shows alongside vanilla and baking spice on the nose of this well-priced bottling from the Center of Effort team. The palate will please many, thanks to buoyant acidity and bright red cherry, raspberry and garrigue flavors.

title: Domaine Jacourette 2016 L'Ange et Luce Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The wine is light and fruity—properly crisp with attractive acidity. The red fruits shine through the light texture and touch of spice creates a bright wine full of final fruitiness.

title: Lafond 2014 Musque Clone Lafond Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Mellow and reserved at first, this clonal study shows wet river stone and key lime scents on the nose. The palate leads with slightly sour lemon and orange rind flavors, opening into a sweeter honeysuckle tone and finishing on ripe peach, melon and toasted nut.

title: Le Vigne 2014 Nikiara Red (Paso Robles)
description: This is one of the Fillippini family winery's best barrel blends, comprised of 71% Cabernet Sauvignon, 14% Malbec, 10% Merlot and 5% Petit Verdot. The nose shows Concord grape, wisteria and black licorice aromas, while the palate doubles down on the licorice spice, with blueberry fruit, char and pepper in the background.

title: Lemelson 2014 Stermer Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Scents of stem and earth accompany rhubarb and beet-root flavors. The acids and tannins combine into a lemon-tea note, and the wine overall seems relatively thin compared with past vintages.

title: Lichen Estate 2015 Moonglow Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Tea leaf, cherry and sweet vermouth aromas precede lightly tart cherry, rhubarb and herb flavors in this lean, moderately tannic and un-oaky wine. It's appealing and appetizing in an austere way, giving just enough satisfaction.

title: Domaine Saint Roman d'Esclans 2016 Bain de Soleil Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This estate lies in a valley one set of ridges behind the Mediterranean. The sheltered location gives a warm style of wine, properly pale in color but also with delicious ripe red fruits touched by caramel. Drink the wine now.

title: Dürnberg 2016 Getränk Grüner Veltliner (Weinland Österreich)
description: This wine's nose is rather subdued, but the palate comes in with hints of green pear and lemon. Dry, light and clean, with the tiniest bit of enlivening spritz, it's as thirst-quenching as its name (Getränk, which translates to “beverage”) suggests.

title: J. McClelland 2013 Petit Verdot (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 10% Malbec, this wine is hearty, spicy and herbal, with big, bittersweet oak and chalky, dusty tannins. That chalkiness grips the palate, bolstering coffee, clove and blackberry flavors.

title: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2013 Bastoni Vineyards Petite Sirah (Sonoma County)
description: Earthy and leathery, this medium-bodied, ripe varietal wine dabbles in vanilla, blueberry and coffee cake aromas and flavors, finishing with a welcome softness.

title: Mercer 2014 Malbec (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Light aromas of herb, plum, vanilla, cocoa and dark fruit lead to a palate that is simultaneously sweet and tart, with a plush midpalate. It provides intrigue.

title: Merriman 2013 Merriman Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Slightly high-toned, this forward, spicy wine mixes cranberry and cherry fruit in a solid tannic substantial wine. It's got a fair amount of power and punches through quickly to a tight finish.

title: Miro 2014 Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Smooth, velvety texture makes for a pleasant mouthfeel in this rich, robust wine. Gamy and bright with acidity, it boasts plum, raspberry and strawberry flavors that contribute to its overall high-toned character, as a whisper of black coffee accompanies the finish.

title: Bennett Lane 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine shows intense bittersweet tobacco and dried herb flavors, wrapped in a subtle greenness. Dense and rich, it presents its ripe and full-bodied weight with a leathery texture on the palate.
